page.title: 02HISTORY
page.content: The area has long been dominated by the Tufton family. They are no longer resident.Their family home, Hothfield Place, visited by Queen Elizabeth 1st was used by the military during World War 2, was subsequently demolished by the family for economic reasons & most of the estate sold. When the railway came to Ashford the Tufton's had a station/halt built (now disused except for siding to Tarmac works).The connecting Rd between Hothfield & Westwell is thus known as Station Rd. Highwaymen operated from Foxenhill Toll & a gibbet was conveniently placed at a nearby crossroad. Cade Rd. was named after Jack Cade reputed to have been in hiding here.
